qas.question: The brain is surrounded by what type of fluid?
The brain is separated from the bloodstream by what feature?
The two main structures that protect the brain are what?
What type of disease if often studied to understand damage to the brain?
What type of animal is most commonly used to study brain damage?

context: Another approach to brain function is to examine the consequences of damage to specific brain areas. Even though it is protected by <a2_0>the skull and meninges<a2_0/>, surrounded by <a0_0>cerebrospinal fluid<a0_0/>, and isolated from the bloodstream by <a1_0>the blood–brain barrier<a1_0/>, the delicate nature of the brain makes it vulnerable to numerous diseases and several types of damage. In humans, the effects of <a3_0>strokes<a3_0/> and other types of brain damage have been a key source of information about brain function. Because there is no ability to experimentally control the nature of the damage, however, this information is often difficult to interpret. In animal studies, most commonly involving <a4_0>rats<a4_0/>, it is possible to use electrodes or locally injected chemicals to produce precise patterns of damage and then examine the consequences for behavior.
